channel.title: Does this flow..?
channel.description:
Well, I have a DBQ [Document Based Question (Essay)] due tomorrow for APUSH (AP US History) and I'm not sure if my introduction flows at all. Suggestions please. :)
Between the years 1941 and 1949, many events and developments regarding the United States and the Soviet Union increased suspicion and tension between these two nations. Prior to entering World War II, the United States and the Soviet Union had a decent relationship. However, this relationship quickly deteriorated during WWII as the United States attempted to halt and contain the Soviet Union’s endeavor to spread communism. This rapid decline of the relationship between the United States and the Soviet Union led to stronger tensions between both nations.
During WWII, both the United States and the Soviet Union were striving to become the world’s “greatest voice.” Both nations conveyed tensions about which nation would emerge as the world’s leader after WWII. In order to impede the Soviet Union’s attempt to become the world leader, the United States, pressured, decided to open up a second front. “The absence of a second front prepares the ground for a strong Soviet stand in the view of foreign policy.” (Document B). The United State’s ambassador stated this in 1943 in order to emphasize the reality that the United States, pressured by . . .

item.title: Does this flow..?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:12, topic:334964”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=431355.msg3167843#msg3167843 date=1270168433]

Looks good, but “great voice” doesn’t have a location to were you got the quote from? I am not sure if its from the same document, or what not, but my English teacher says it is better to have all of your quoted materiel with its location even if you have a quote from the same reference?

I may be talking out of my ass though?

From a document.

@Topic: Problem solved; got an A.

Your teacher already had them graded?

He grades them the day we hand them in. We can go back at the end of the day to get our grade. My biggest concern right now is the multiple choice portion of the assessment, since my grade will be the average of the two assignments. :
[/quote]I don’t know why you were worried about the written portion, as you’re one of the most grammatically inclined here.[/quote]
I don’t think I’m good at writing, so I asked for opinions.

Read full topic

Hated DBQ’S but got a passed the examine and got a 5.

Look’s good, just remember to back up everything you say.
What is the question?[/quote]
Wow, nice. Thanks for the feedback.

“Analyze developments from 1941 to 1949 that increased suspicion and tension between the United States and the Soviet Union.”
